title: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation
text: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation Tools active learning computer experiments, support learning curve extrapolation progress forecasting.

title: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation
text: Work progress, nothing considered stable yet.

title: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation
code: # you almost certainly need: install.packages(c("mlr3learners", "DiceKriging"))  # Install celecx remotes::install_github("mlr-org/celecx")

title: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation
text: Run active learning explore unknown function:
code: library("celecx") library("mlr3") library("mlr3learners")  # for regr.km  # Define objective (unknown function to learn) objective <- ObjectiveRFun$new(  fun = function(xs) list(y = sin(xs$x * pi)),  domain = ps(x = p_dbl(lower = 0, upper = 2)),  codomain = ps(y = p_dbl(tags = "learn")) )  # Run active learning result <- optimize_active(  objective = objective,  term_evals = 10L,  learner = lrn("regr.km", covtype = "matern5_2"),  se_method = "auto",  batch_size = 2L,  aqf_evals = 20L,  multipoint_method = "greedy" )  # Access results result$instance$archive$data  # All evaluated points  xvals <- seq(0, 2, length.out = 100) yvals.true <- objective$fun(list(x = xvals))$y yvals.pred <- result$optimizer$surrogate$predict(data.table::data.table(x = xvals)) plot(xvals, yvals.true, col = "red", type = "l", xlab = "x", ylab = "y",   main = "Active Learning sin(x) with batch_size = 2") lines(xvals, yvals.pred$mean, col = "blue") lines(xvals, with(yvals.pred, mean + 1.96 * se), col = "blue", lty = 2) lines(xvals, with(yvals.pred, mean - 1.96 * se), col = "blue", lty = 2) text(y ~ x, labels = batch_nr, data = result$instance$archive$data, pos = 1)

title: Computer Experiment LEarning Curve eXtrapolation
text: MIT

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: Extension mlr3mbo::AcqOptimizer applies batch selection strategy diversify returned candidate set. Creates new BatchProposer. Optimize acquisition function apply batch selection strategy. Print method.

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: optimizer (bbotk::OptimizerBatch) Optimizer used acquisition optimization. terminator (bbotk::Terminator) Terminator used acquisition optimization. acq_function (NULL | mlr3mbo::AcqFunction) Acquisition function. Can set later via $acq_function. batch_strategy (function) Batch selection strategy. Must signature function(candidates, scores, batch_size, surrogate, archive, search_space) return integer indices candidates. pool_factor (integer(1)) Pool size multiplier. Pool size n_candidates * pool_factor. Default 10. callbacks (NULL | list()) Callbacks. Passed parent mlr3mbo::AcqOptimizer. ... (ignored).

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: data.table::data.table() 1 row per candidate.

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: class implements wrapper around parent mlr3mbo::AcqOptimizer: temporarily requests larger number candidates, -selects desired batch size using batch_strategy. Batch strategies operate pool already ranked acquisition optimizer follow convention: lower better (sign adjusted automatically based acquisition codomain).

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: pool_factor (integer(1)) Multiplier pool size. internal pool size n_candidates * pool_factor. batch_strategy (function) Batch selection strategy.

title: Batch Proposer — BatchProposer
text: Inherits parameters mlr3mbo::AcqOptimizer, particular: n_candidates: number points propose (batch size) warmstart, warmstart_size, skip_already_evaluated, catch_errors, logging_level

title: ConfigurableComponent — ConfigurableComponent
text: Base class objects unifies configuration state. ConfigurableComponent-objects always active bindings reflect arguments given constructor. also $param_set field containing paradox::ParamSet, used fine-grained configuration object. Things somehow determine object can used (e.g. kinds things compatible ), particularly things can changed constructions likely construction arguments; others likely $param_set. Initialize ConfigurableComponent. Helper print outputs. Printer. Set parameter values fields one step.

title: ConfigurableComponent — ConfigurableComponent
text: id (character(1)) Identifier object. left NULL, object get ID. param_set (paradox::ParamSet | NULL) Set hyperparameters / configuration parameters. additional_configuration (character(1)) Additional configuration settings. Anything passed must field active binding object passed initialization argument (top-level) constructor. additional_phash_input (character()) Names fields (self private) whose values influence persistent hash (phash). Useful subclasses expose additional configuration state outside constructor arguments parameter set. Note entries additional_configuration automatically included (may expensive compute). additional_phash_input reference data additional_configuration fields computed. ... (named ) .values (named list())

title: ConfigurableComponent — ConfigurableComponent
text: state object completely determined : arguments passed initialization, must accessible fields active bindings object. param_set configuration parameteres additional fields / active bindings, must listed additional_configuration. may active bindings, convey relevant state.

title: ConfigurableComponent — ConfigurableComponent
text: id (character(1)) Identifier object. Used tables, plot text output. param_set (paradox::ParamSet | NULL) Set hyperparameters. hash (character(1)) Stable hash includes id, parameter values (present) additional configuration settings (construction class fields) state. Makes use private$.additional_phash_input() function collect additional information, must therefore implemented subclasses. phash (character(1)) Hash includes id additional configuration settings (construction class fields) parameter values state. Makes use private$.additional_phash_input() function collect additional information, must therefore implemented subclasses.

title: Context for Search Instance — ContextSearch
text: Similar bbotk's ContextBatch, SearchInstance instead bbotk::OptimInstanceBatch.

title: Context for Search Instance — ContextSearch
text: instance (SearchInstance). optimizer (bbotk::Optimizer | NULL). xdt (data.table::data.table) points latest batch instance$eval_batch().

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: Tracks per-batch metrics search, providing data needed progress monitoring, learning curve analysis, forecasting. Creates new MetricsTracker. Log metrics completed batch. Add new metric track (future batches). Remove metric tracking. Update extra_data used metric functions. Clear logged history. Get metrics specific batch. Extract single metric's history vector. Printer.

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: metrics (list) Named list metric functions. Names become column names history table. function signature function(archive, surrogate = NULL, ...) return scalar. extra_data (list) Additional data passed metric functions via .... example, list(test_data = test_dt, optimum = 0.5). fun (function) Metric function. backfill (logical(1)) TRUE existing history, attempt compute metric past batches. Requires archive snapshots may available. keep_data (logical(1)) TRUE, keep column data table. Default FALSE removes . batch_nr (integer(1)) batch number retrieve. name (character(1)) Name metric. ... (ignored). metric_fun (function) metric function. archive (bbotk::ArchiveBatch) Current archive. surrogate (mlr3mbo::Surrogate) Current surrogate (may NULL). extra_args (list) Extra arguments function.

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: Invisibly returns new row data.table. single-row data.table, NULL batch found. numeric vector metric values. Scalar metric value. Initialize empty history table.

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: tracker stores history table one row per batch. Built-columns: batch_nr: Batch number (1-indexed) n_evals: Cumulative number evaluations timestamp: batch logged Additional columns computed user-defined metric functions. functions receive current state (archive, surrogate, extra data) return scalar value.

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: data (data.table) history table logged metrics. metrics (list) registered metric functions. extra_data (list) Additional data passed metric functions. n_batches (integer(1)) Number batches logged. metric_names (character()) Names tracked metrics (excluding built-columns). latest (data.table) recently logged row, NULL history. Compute single metric value.

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: Metric functions signature:   return single numeric value. ... can include additional context like test data, known optimum, etc. See search_metrics.R built-metrics: metric_best_y(): Best observed y value (optimization) metric_regret(): Gap known optimum (optimization) metric_model_rmse(): Surrogate RMSE test data (learning) metric_mean_variance(): Average prediction variance (learning)

title: Metrics Tracker — MetricsTracker
text: $data field returns complete history data.table, can directly fed learning curve extrapolation models. n_evals column serves x-axis (sample size) forecasting methods.

what: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
title: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
text: bbotk::Objective subclass evaluation happens table lookup pre-evaluated dataset. useful "replaying" optimization historical data testing optimization algorithms known datasets. Creates new instance R6 class. Evaluates multiple input values objective function.

title: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
text: dataset (TaskRegr | data.frame | data.table) Dataset containing pre-evaluated configurations. Must contain columns matching domain parameters codomain targets. domain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing input space. parameter IDs must correspond columns dataset (excluding codomain columns). codomain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing output space. Must contain least one target tagged "minimize", "maximize", "learn". Target IDs must correspond columns dataset. id (character(1)) Identifier objective. check_values (logical(1)) Whether check validity input configurations domain. xdt (data.table) data.table one configuration per row.

title: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
text: data.table::data.table() containing codomain columns.

title: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
text: dataset must contain columns parameters domain targets codomain. Evaluation fails informative error requested configuration present dataset. Column type expectations: ParamDbl corresponds numeric columns ParamInt corresponds integerish columns (coerced integer) ParamFct corresponds factor character columns (character converted factor) ParamLgl corresponds logical columns Evaluation uses exact matching (floating point tolerance). Values expected sampled directly dataset without arithmetic modifications.

title: Objective Function Based on Pre-evaluated Dataset — ObjectiveDataset
text: data (data.table) Read-access internal data table. task (mlr3::TaskRegr) Returns TaskRegr constructed internal data. nrow (integer(1)) Number rows (configurations) dataset.

what: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
title: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
text: bbotk::Objective subclass evaluation uses fitted regression learner predict outcomes. useful surrogate-based optimization model trained observed data want optimize predicted outcomes. Creates new instance R6 class. Evaluates multiple input values objective function.

title: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) fitted regression learner. Must trained via $train() creating objective. domain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing input space. parameter IDs must correspond features learner trained . codomain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing output space. Must contain least one target tagged "minimize", "maximize", "learn". id (character(1)) Identifier objective. check_values (logical(1)) Whether check validity input configurations domain. xdt (data.table) data.table one configuration per row.

title: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
text: data.table::data.table() containing codomain columns.

title: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
text: learner must trained creating objective. domain parameters must correspond features learner trained . factor features, domain levels must subset levels present training data (learner generalize unseen factor levels). Type compatibility: ParamDbl corresponds numeric training features ParamInt corresponds integer numeric training features ParamFct corresponds factor training features (domain levels must subset) ParamLgl corresponds logical training features

title: Objective Function Based on a Fitted Learner — ObjectiveLearner
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) Read-access internal learner. train_task (mlr3::TaskRegr) Returns task learner trained (without data backend).

title: Null Result Assigner — ResultAssignerNull
text: Result assigner intentionally nothing. useful search runs single "best" point exists, e.g. active learning tasks codomain targets tagged "learn". cases, calling archive$best() undefined error, using default result assigner mlr3mbo appropriate. Creates new ResultAssignerNull. Assigns result instance. implementation nothing (leaves instance$result untouched).

title: Null Result Assigner — ResultAssignerNull
text: instance (bbotk::OptimInstance) instance result assigned .

title: Null Result Assigner — ResultAssignerNull
text: packages (character()) Required packages (none).

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: Container search problem extends bbotk's bbotk::EvalInstance support optimization active learning. Holds objective, search space, archive, terminator, provides evaluation loop mechanics. Unlike bbotk::OptimInstance, class: Supports codomains "learn" tags (addition minimize/maximize) compute objective_multiplicator assign "result" (best point) Creates new SearchInstance. Evaluates batch points adds results archive. Resets instance fresh search. Printer.

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: objective (bbotk::Objective) objective evaluate. Can bbotk Objective subclass including ObjectiveDataset ObjectiveLearner. search_space (paradox::ParamSet) Optional restricted search space. NULL: domain contains TuneTokens, uses whole domain domain contains TuneTokens, derives search space supplied domain already contains TuneTokens. terminator (bbotk::Terminator) stop search. Uses bbotk terminators. archive (bbotk::ArchiveBatch) Optional pre-existing archive. NULL, creates new one. check_values (logical(1)) Whether validate points search_space evaluation. callbacks (list() mlr3misc::Callback) Optional callbacks hook evaluation loop. xdt (data.table) Points evaluate, one row per configuration. ... (ignored).

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: Invisibly returns ydt (codomain values).

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: search instance serves "problem specification" custom search loops. owns archive handles evaluation mechanics. want run full MBO-style loop, prefer using bbotk's bbotk::OptimInstanceBatchSingleCrit / bbotk::OptimInstanceBatchMultiCrit together mlr3mbo::OptimizerMbo. codomains containing "learn" targets, use ResultAssignerNull disable assigning "best" result. Since bbotk's Codomain now natively supports "learn" tags, codomains passed directly ArchiveBatch without conversion. Note calling archive$best() archive$nds_selection() error codomain contains "learn" targets, correct behavior.

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: Callbacks can registered hook evaluation loop. following stages supported: on_optimizer_before_eval: Called evaluating batch on_optimizer_after_eval: Called evaluating batch

title: Search Instance — SearchInstance
text: batch evaluation, terminator checked. terminated, search_terminated_error condition raised. can caught tryCatch(..., search_terminated_error = function(e) ...).

title: Validate Domain and Codomain Structure — assert_domain_codomain

title: Validate Domain and Codomain Structure — assert_domain_codomain

Note paradox's $check_dt() used construction-time validation accept data formats paradox (e.g., factor columns ParamFct, paradox expects character). validation handles conversion/coercion prepares data paradox-compatible queries. bbotk >= 0.9.0, codomains can "learn" tags addition "minimize"/"maximize", check target tags.

what: Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
title: Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
text: Validates fitted learner compatible given domain codomain. Checks learner fitted, domain parameters match trained features, validates type compatibility including factor level constraints.

title: Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) fitted regression learner. domain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing input space. codomain (paradox::ParamSet) Parameter set describing output space.

title: Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
text: TRUE invisibly validation succeeds.

title: Validate Learner Against Domain and Codomain — assert_learner_domain_codomain
text: Type compatibility: ParamDbl -> numeric feature training task ParamInt -> integer numeric feature training task ParamFct -> factor feature training task, domain levels must subset trained factor levels ParamLgl -> logical feature training task

title: Assert Parameter Type Compatibility — assert_param_type_compatible
text: Validates parameter class compatible actual data type.

title: Assert Parameter Type Compatibility — assert_param_type_compatible
text: param_id (character(1)) Parameter identifier error messages. param_class (character(1)) ParamSet class (e.g., "ParamDbl", "ParamInt", "ParamFct", "ParamLgl"). actual_type (character(1)) Actual data type (e.g., "numeric", "integer", "factor", "logical"). context (character(1)) Context error messages (e.g., "data column", "training feature").

title: Assert Parameter Type Compatibility — assert_param_type_compatible
text: TRUE invisibly compatible, otherwise throws error.

title: Batch Selection Strategies — batch_strategies
text: Strategies selecting multiple points scored candidates. used BatchProposer construct batches parallel evaluation.

title: Batch Selection Strategies — batch_strategies
text: batch_size > 1, selecting top-k candidates acquisition score may result redundant evaluations (e.g., many points clustered around current best). Batch strategies address diversifying selection. batch strategy functions return strategy function signature:   strategy function returns integer indices candidates table.
code: function(candidates, scores, batch_size, surrogate, archive, search_space)

title: Batch Selection Strategies — batch_strategies
text: batch_strategy_greedy(): Select top-k acquisition score (baseline) batch_strategy_local_penalization(): Penalize around selected points batch_strategy_diversity(): Mix acquisition score distance selected

title: Diversity Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_diversity
text: Combines acquisition score distance already-selected points. Trades exploitation (good acquisition) exploration (diversity).

title: Diversity Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_diversity
text: diversity_weight (numeric(1)) Weight distance component. Range [0, 1]. 0: Pure acquisition (greedy) 1: Pure diversity (ignore acquisition scores) 0.5: Equal weight

title: Diversity Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_diversity
text: batch strategy function.

title: Diversity Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_diversity
text: Combined score candidate :   selection, distances recomputed.

title: Greedy Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_greedy
text: Simple strategy selects k candidates best acquisition scores. diversification; may select clustered points.

title: Greedy Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_greedy
text: batch strategy function.

title: Greedy Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_greedy
text: baseline strategy. Use : batch_size = 1 (single point selection) Candidates already diverse (e.g., LHS) Speed critical

title: Local Penalization Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_local_penalization
text: selecting point, penalizes nearby candidates selecting next. Encourages spatial diversity batch.

title: Local Penalization Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_local_penalization
text: bandwidth (numeric(1)) Penalization bandwidth. Points within distance (normalized) selected point scores penalized. Default 0.1 (10% domain range). penalization (numeric(1)) much worsen scores nearby points. Added acquisition score. Default Inf (effectively removes nearby candidates).

title: Local Penalization Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_local_penalization
text: batch strategy function.

title: Local Penalization Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_local_penalization
text: Algorithm: Select best candidate Penalize scores candidates within bandwidth selected point Select next best (penalized scores) Repeat batch complete Distance computed using Gower distance (handles mixed types).

title: Local Penalization Batch Strategy — batch_strategy_local_penalization
text: Ginsbourger, D., Le Riche, R., & Carraro, L. (2010). Kriging well-suited parallelize optimization.

title: Grid Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_grid
text: Generates candidates regular grid. suitable low-dimensional problems specific resolution needed.

title: Grid Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_grid
text: resolution (integer(1) | named integer()) Number points per dimension. Can single value applied dimensions, named vector per-dimension values.

title: Grid Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_grid
text: candidate generator function.

title: Grid Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_grid
text: Warning: Grid size grows exponentially dimension. d dimensions resolution r, produces r^d points. Uses paradox::generate_design_grid() internally.

title: LHS Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_lhs
text: Generates candidates using Latin Hypercube Sampling, provides good space-filling properties.

title: LHS Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_lhs
text: candidate generator function.

title: LHS Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_lhs
text: LHS ensures variable's marginal distribution uniformly covered, even relatively small number samples. Good default choice problems. Uses paradox::generate_design_lhs() internally.

title: Local Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_local
text: Generates candidates locally around promising regions, identified archive. Good exploitation/refinement.

title: Local Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_local
text: n_centers (integer(1)) Number archive points sample around. Points selected y values (best first). radius (numeric(1)) Sampling radius around center, fraction domain range. Default 0.1 (10% range).

title: Local Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_local
text: candidate generator function.

title: Local Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_local
text: Algorithm: Select n_centers best points archive center, generate n/n_centers local samples Local samples uniform within hypercube around center Note: generator needs access archive, signature extended function(search_space, n, archive).

title: Mixed Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_mixed
text: Combines global local sampling balance exploration exploitation.

title: Mixed Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_mixed
code: candidate_generator_mixed(   global_fraction = 0.5,   global_generator = NULL,   local_generator = NULL )

title: Mixed Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_mixed
text: global_fraction (numeric(1)) Fraction candidates global sampling (LHS). Default 0.5. global_generator (function) Generator global samples. Default LHS. local_generator (function) Generator local samples. Default local generator.

title: Mixed Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_mixed
text: candidate generator function.

title: Mixed Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_mixed
text: Splits requested n candidates global local generators. Useful maintaining exploration focusing promising regions.

title: Random Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_random
text: Generates candidates using pure random sampling.

title: Random Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_random
text: candidate generator function.

title: Random Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_random
text: Simpler faster LHS, may poor coverage small n. Use speed matters coverage, n large. Uses paradox::generate_design_random() internally.

title: Sobol Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_sobol
text: Generates candidates using Sobol quasi-random sequences, even better space-filling properties LHS low discrepancy.

title: Sobol Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_sobol
text: candidate generator function.

title: Sobol Candidate Generator — candidate_generator_sobol
text: Sobol sequences deterministic provide excellent coverage. However, designed continuous spaces; categorical variables handled discretizing.

title: Candidate Point Generators — candidate_generators
text: Functions generating candidate points batch proposer selects. Different generators trade coverage, speed, adaptivity.

title: Candidate Point Generators — candidate_generators
text: generator functions return generator function signature:   generator function returns data.table n candidate configurations.

title: Candidate Point Generators — candidate_generators
text: candidate_generator_lhs(): Latin Hypercube Sampling (space-filling) candidate_generator_random(): Pure random sampling candidate_generator_sobol(): Sobol quasi-random sequence candidate_generator_grid(): Regular grid (small spaces) candidate_generator_local(): Local sampling around best points candidate_generator_mixed(): Combination global local sampling

what: Codomain Helpers for Active Learning — codomain_helpers
title: Codomain Helpers for Active Learning — codomain_helpers
text: Helper functions working codomains include "learn" tag active learning, addition bbotk's standard "minimize"/"maximize" tags.

title: Codomain Helpers for Active Learning — codomain_helpers
text: bbotk >= 0.9.0, bbotk::Codomain class natively supports "learn" tags. helper functions provide convenient accessors filtering targets purpose (optimization vs learning).

title: Codomain Helpers for Active Learning — codomain_helpers
text: "minimize": Lower values better; seek x minimizes f(x) "maximize": Higher values better; seek x maximizes f(x) "learn": want learn f(x) accurately across domain; optimization direction

what: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
text: Wraps regression learner trains bootstrap ensemble. Predictions return mean SE across bootstrap samples. Creates new instance R6 class.

title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) Base learner bootstrap.

title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
text: learner creates bootstrap ensemble : Taking n_bootstrap bootstrap samples (sampling replacement) Training base learner sample storing trained state prediction, restoring state computing predictions Computing mean SD predictions across ensemble standard deviation across bootstrap predictions serves standard error estimate. wrapped base learner ($wrapped) remains untrained training wrapper. Use $base_learner() get trained clone base learner.

title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
text: wrapped (LearnerRegr) Read-access wrapped base learner. param_set (paradox::ParamSet) combined parameter set.

title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
text: $wrapped :: mlr3::LearnerRegr Read-access wrapped base learner.

title: Bootstrap Ensemble Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.bootstrap_se
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Wrap ranger with bootstrap SE learner <- lrn("regr.bootstrap_se", learner = lrn("regr.ranger")) learner$param_set$set_values(n_bootstrap = 10)  # Train on a task task <- tsk("mtcars") learner$train(task)  # Predict with SE pred <- learner$predict(task) pred$se  # Standard errors } # }

what: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: Wraps quantile regression learner converts quantile predictions SE. Assumes approximate normality map inter-quantile range standard error. Creates new instance R6 class.

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) Base quantile learner. Must support predict_type = "quantiles".

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: learner: Trains base learner supports quantile predictions predicts lower upper quantiles SE prediction inter-quantile range multiplied given factor

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: wrapped (LearnerRegr)\cr Read-access wrapped base learner. param_set (paradox::ParamSet)\cr combined parameter set.

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: quantile_response :: numeric(1) Quantile response use prediction. Initialized 0.5 (median). quantile_lower :: numeric(1) Lower quantile SE estimation. Initialized 0.1 (10th percentile). quantile_upper :: numeric(1) Upper quantile SE estimation. Initialized 0.9 (90th percentile). se_factor :: numeric(1) Factor multiply inter-quantile range get SE. Initialized 0.5. initial setup forwards wrapped learner's response prediction calculates SE half range predicted 0.1 0.9 quantiles.

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
text: $wrapped :: mlr3::LearnerRegr\cr Read-access wrapped base learner.

title: Quantile Regression Learner with SE Prediction — mlr_learners_regr.quantile_se
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Requires a quantile regression learner (e.g., from mlr3extralearners) # base_learner <- lrn("regr.ranger")  # Assuming it supports quantiles # learner <- lrn("regr.quantile_se", learner = base_learner) # learner$param_set$set_values(quantile_lower = 0.1, quantile_upper = 0.9)  # Train and predict # task <- tsk("mtcars") # learner$train(task) # pred <- learner$predict(task) # pred$se  # Standard errors derived from quantiles } # }

title: Pool-Based Optimizer — mlr_optimizers_pool
text: Optimizer generates pool candidates evaluates . extension bbotk::OptimizerBatchRandomSearch allows flexible candidate generation. Creates new instance R6 class.

title: Pool-Based Optimizer — mlr_optimizers_pool
text: candidate_generator (function) Function generate candidate points. Must signature function(search_space, n) return data.table n candidates. Default candidate_generator_lhs(). pool_size (integer(1)) Number candidates generate evaluate. NULL, calculates remaining evaluations terminator (requires bbotk::TerminatorEvals). Default use remaining evaluations terminator.

title: Pool-Based Optimizer — mlr_optimizers_pool
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ optimizer <- opt("pool") optimizer$param_set$set_values(   candidate_generator = candidate_generator_lhs(),   pool_size = 100L ) } # }

title: Run Active Learning — optimize_active
text: Convenience function constructs active learning mlr3mbo::OptimizerMbo via optimizer_active_learning(), runs bbotk instance, (optionally) logs metrics via CallbackMetricsTracker.

title: Run Active Learning — optimize_active
code: optimize_active(   objective,   search_space = NULL,   term_evals = NULL,   terminator = NULL,   metrics_tracker = NULL,   ... )

title: Run Active Learning — optimize_active
text: objective (bbotk::Objective) Objective evaluate. Typically single codomain target tagged "learn". search_space (NULL | paradox::ParamSet) Optional restricted search space. NULL, search space derived objective$domain (logic bbotk's OptimInstanceBatch). term_evals (NULL | integer(1)) Convenience evaluation budget used terminator NULL. terminator (NULL | bbotk::Terminator) Terminator outer active learning loop. NULL, trm("evals", n_evals = term_evals) constructed. metrics_tracker (NULL | MetricsTracker) Optional metrics tracker. provided, CallbackMetricsTracker attached instance. ... Passed optimizer_active_learning().

title: Run Active Learning — optimize_active
text: list() : instance: SearchInstance optimizer: configured mlr3mbo::OptimizerMbo metrics_tracker: passed tracker (NULL)

title: Active Learning Optimizer Factory — optimizer_active_learning
text: Convenience constructor wires together mlr3mbo::OptimizerMbo active learning uncertainty-based acquisition function (SD) optional multipoint (batch) proposal via BatchProposer batch strategies.

title: Active Learning Optimizer Factory — optimizer_active_learning
code: optimizer_active_learning(   learner,   se_method = c("auto", "bootstrap", "quantile"),   se_method_n_bootstrap = 30L,   batch_size = 1L,   multipoint_method = c("greedy", "local_penalization", "diversity", "constant_liar"),   aqf_optimizer = opt("pool"),   aqf_evals = 100L )

title: Active Learning Optimizer Factory — optimizer_active_learning
text: learner (mlr3::LearnerRegr) Base regression learner used surrogate. se_method (character(1)) obtain standard errors: "auto": use native "se" supported learner, otherwise "bootstrap". "bootstrap": wrap via LearnerRegrBootstrapSE. "quantile": wrap via LearnerRegrQuantileSE (requires "quantiles" support). se_method_n_bootstrap (integer(1)) Number bootstrap replicates "bootstrap". Ignored otherwise. batch_size (integer(1)) Number points proposed per MBO iteration. multipoint_method (character(1)) Batch selection strategy: "greedy": top-k acquisition score (equivalent n_candidates = batch_size) "local_penalization": local penalization based diversity "diversity": score/diversity trade-"constant_liar": uses mlr3mbo::bayesopt_mpcl (constant liar loop) aqf_optimizer (bbotk::Optimizer | mlr3mbo::AcqOptimizer) Acquisition optimization backend. bbotk::Optimizer provided, wrapped BatchProposer. Default opt("pool"). aqf_evals (integer(1)) Evaluation budget acquisition optimization (TerminatorEvals$n_evals).

title: Active Learning Optimizer Factory — optimizer_active_learning
text: Configured mlr3mbo::OptimizerMbo.

title: Active Learning Optimizer Factory — optimizer_active_learning
text: helper focuses common active learning setup project: uses SD acquisition function (mlr3mbo::AcqFunctionSD) uses surrogate can provide standard errors (either native "se", LearnerRegrBootstrapSE, LearnerRegrQuantileSE) disables assigning "best" point via ResultAssignerNull (required codomains tagged "learn")

title: Sample in Local Region — sample_local
text: data.table n points.

title: Search Metrics — search_metrics

title: Search Metrics — search_metrics

title: Search Metrics — search_metrics
text: metric_model_rmse: Surrogate RMSE test data metric_model_mae: Surrogate MAE test data metric_model_r2: Surrogate R-squared test data metric_mean_variance: Average prediction variance grid metric_max_variance: Maximum prediction variance grid metric_integrated_variance: Integral variance domain

title: Search Metrics — search_metrics
text: metric_n_evals: Total evaluations (built-tracker) metric_improvement_rate: Improvement per evaluation
